intro: Sicyos microcarpus var. laysanensis, commonly known as Laysan fanpetia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Laysan. It is a member of the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green fruits that are typically less than 1 centimeter in diameter. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered critically endangered, with conservation efforts focused on protecting its remnant populations.
